installer.title: BatchExpert+
installer.description: Installer for ILS Automation's Batch Expert+

panel.title: ILS Automation Installer for Batch Expert+
panel.preamble: Welcome to the ILS Automation installer for Batch Expert+. This version of the installer is designed for new installations on Ignition 8. It installs a "bare-bones" project along with a collection of example screens to accelerate configuration. Before continuing, please make sure that you have defined a database connection, e.g. BEDB, to hold your configuration and results.

panel.title: End User License Agreement (EULA)
panel.preamble: Click on the button below to view the license that specifies permissible use of the software to be installed. Select the checkbox to indicate acceptance of the terms. You must accept the license terms to proceed.

panel.title: Install Configuration Tags
panel.preamble: This page creates BatchExpert configuration tags that define which batch-tracking parameters are important in your installation.

panel.title: Python Extensions for the Batch Expert+
panel.preamble: This page loads custom Python modules that support Batch Expert+.

artifact.name: ILS jar files for Batch Expert+

panel.title: Define Database Connections
panel.preamble: Specify the database connection and DBMS-type that are used for BatchExpert+.

panel.title: Verify User Roles
panel.preamble: This is an optional step that provides a check of authentication profiles to verify that at least one of them includes a user assigned to the "Operator" role as required by BatchExpert.

panel.title: Batch-Expert Feature Selection
panel.preamble: Configure the Batch-Expert+ installation to include the SFC and other optional features. Note that these features are record as tag values. These decisions are, therefore, easily reversed.

artifact.name: CAMPAIGN
artifact.comment: Configure Batch Expert+ to add campaign as a parameter for batch tracking.

artifact.name: CODE
artifact.comment: Configure Batch Expert+ to add batch code as a parameter for batch tracking.

artifact.name: CONDITION
artifact.comment: Configure Batch Expert+ to add condition as a parameter for batch tracking.

artifact.name: CUSTOMER
artifact.comment: Configure Batch Expert+ to add customer as a parameter for batch tracking.

artifact.name: EFT
artifact.comment: Configure Batch Expert+ to add auto EFT clearance as a feature.

artifact.name: FERMENTATION
artifact.comment: Configure Batch Expert+ to add fermentation (organism) as a parameter for batch tracking.

artifact.name: OWNER
artifact.comment: Configure Batch Expert+ to add owner as a parameter for batch tracking.

artifact.name: PRODUCT
artifact.comment: Configure Batch Expert+ to add product as a parameter for batch tracking.

artifact.name: PROJECT
artifact.comment: Configure Batch Expert+ to add project as a parameter for batch tracking.

artifact.name: RESOURCE
artifact.comment: Configure Batch Expert+ to add resource as a parameter for batch tracking.

artifact.name: SEED
artifact.comment: Configure Batch Expert+ to add seed as a parameter for batch tracking.

artifact.name: SETUP
artifact.comment: Configure Batch Expert+ to add setup as a parameter for batch tracking.

artifact.name: SFC
artifact.comment: Enable Sequential Functional Charts (SFCs) within Batch-Expert. Use of this feature requires the Ignition SFC module and involves installation of a custom SFC module from ILS.

artifact.name: STRAIN
artifact.comment: Configure Batch Expert+ to add strain as a parameter for batch tracking.

artifact.name: VESSEL
artifact.comment: Configure Batch Expert+ to add vessel id as a parameter for batch tracking.

panel.title: Icons
panel.preamble: A small number of custom icons are used in Vision screens. This panel installs them.

panel.title: Database Create Scripts for Batch Expert+
panel.preamble: This page provides the opportunity for populating the database instance specified on the 'definition' panel. This script is appropriate for a new installation only. As a safety measure, the database creation step will fail unless any previous instance is explicitly cleared.

artifact.name: Drop Tables
artifact.comment: Clear the existing database of all tables, procedures and indices. This step is only needed if the database is to be completely re-created.

artifact.name: Create Tables
artifact.comment: Create tables and indices required for Batch Expert.

artifact.name: Populate Tables
artifact.comment: Populate tables with common choose-list entries.

panel.title: Install UDT Definitions
panel.preamble: The user-defined tag types describe the controllers in your installation. A special simulated-controller is also included for simulation and testing.

panel.title: Install Custom Modules
panel.preamble: This step installs the ILS custom modules necessary for BatchExpert+ installations that include the SFC feature.

panel.title: Install the BatchExpert+ Master Project
panel.preamble: The BatchExpert+ "Master" project contains standard windows and tags. These are globally applicable to all customers. Upon an update this is the project that gets changed.

artifact.name: Master
artifact.comment: Install the latest Master project. It will be loaded with a name that includes the current version.

panel.title: Install the BatchExpert+ Site-specific Project
panel.preamble: The starter project contains examples of windows designed to be customized for a specific site. On a product update, these windows will be left untouched.

artifact.name: Site
artifact.comment: Install site-specific project template it into the project which was just installed in the step above.

panel.title: Configuration Scripts
panel.preamble: This page performs configuration updates that are not database-related for BatchExpert+ 3.0.

artifact.name: Configure Pen Palette
artifact.comment: Update the palette of colors used to plot properties of one unit versus another.

panel.title: Set Gateway Defaults
panel.preamble: Set properties in the internal database of the Gateway. In particular, named "Batch Expert" entries are made for alarm journals, alarm pipelines and smtp mail servers. The user is given gateway edit privileges.

panel.title: Product Documentation
panel.preamble: In addition to the release notes, documentation includes a getting started guide.

panel.title: Installation Summary
panel.preamble: The list below shows which of the installation steps have been completed. Selecting "Finish" will record the current version of Batch Expert+ in the Gateway internal database.

epilog.title: Installation Complete
epilog.preamble: The automated installation and configuration of Batch Expert+ is complete. There are just a few more manual steps required.
epilog.note: Make sure that the new Master project is "heritable"
Give the starter project with a customer-appropriate name. Make the "Master" project its parent.
Several modules with active components have been installed. A Gateway restart is required.
